thig14.1:1.1: "Bhikkhunī Subhā was going to Jīvaka's charming mango grove."
thig14.1:1.3: 'sannivāreti' is related to "nīvaraṇa" (the 'five hindrances'). I think "A rogue blocked her," or "A rogue got in her way," or "A rogue obstructed her" would be better, particularly since below you translated 'ovariyāna' as "holding back".
thig14.1:1.4: "so Subhā said this to him:" or "so this is what Subhā said to him:"
